reference.title: Classification map
reference.shortdesc: You classify your content by adding relationships between content topics and subject topics.

section.title: Description
section.p: You can add classifications to your existing navigation map by nesting references to subject topics inside the existing references to content topics. You use the element to refer to subject topics. You can also classify sets of topics using a element.

example.title: Example

ul.li: The websecure.dita topic is about the Web Server and Security subjects.
The loginsetup.dita topic is about the Configuring, Web Server, and Security subjects.

example.codeblock: <topicref href="websecure.xml"> <topicsubject> <subjectref href="webserver.xml"/> <subjectref href="security.xml"/> </topicsubject> <topicref href="https_protocol.xml"/> ... other subordinate content topics ... </topicref> <topicref href="loginsetup.xml" collection-type="sequence"> <topicsubject> <subjectref href="configuring.xml"/> <subjectref href="webserver.xml"/> <subjectref href="security.xml"/> </topicsubject> <topicref href="editinguserdef.xml"/> ... other subordinate content topics ... </topicref>
